text: James E. Cayne (February 14, 1934 â€“ December 28, 2021) was an American businessman. He was the CEO of Bear Stearns. In 2006, he became "the first Wall Street chief to own a company stake worth more than $1 billion". In February 2009, Cayne was named in Time Magazine's list of "25 People to Blame for the Financial Crisis." Cayne died on December 28, 2021 at a hospital in Long Branch, New Jersey from problems caused by a stroke, at the age of 87.James Cayne, CEO for Bear Stearns Rise and Fall, Dies at 87 ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American billionaires Category:Businesspeople from Evanston, Illinois Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Deaths from stroke
title: James Cayne
